DOC.brief_summary: This study will assess whether adding a secure message reminder to routine care improves the percentage of patients who complete a follow-up appointment with a new, documented blood pressure reading.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of a Secure Message Reminder on Hypertension Follow-up at an Integrated Health Care System
DOC.detailed_description: Hypertension is one of the leading risk factors for cardiovascular disease. Optimizing blood pressure management can help prevent adverse cardiovascular outcomes. The National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) defines blood pressure control as less than 140/90 mmHg. Per this definition, less than half of Americans with hypertension are considered controlled. Literature has been published describing several ways of improving blood pressure management, but results have been variable.
DOC.criteria: Member of Kaiser Permanente Georgia Pharmacy Cardiac Risk Service (PCRS) 1875 years of age Enrolled in http://kp.org Most recent documented blood pressure is greater than or equal to 140/90 mmHg Most recent documented blood pressure is greater than or equal to 180/110 mmHg
